spec.scope: Modelling knowledge for thesauri, classification schemes, taxonomies, etc.

info.p: The abbreviation SKOS stands for the Simple Knowledge Organization System, which is a specification developed within W3C.

It is a model of knowledge for knowledge organisation systems such as thesauri, classification schemes, taxonomies and other types of structured controlled vocabulary. The main objective of SKOS is to enable easy sharing and linking of controlled structured vocabularies for semantic web.

titleStmt.title: SKOS Simple Knowledge Organization System: Reference

info.p: The data model of SKOS is defined using an RDF schema
In the description of the SKOS data model uses the vocabulary taken from OWL.
